intro: Blepharis grisea, commonly known as the gray blepharis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually pale green to grayish in color, which helps it blend into its natural surroundings. Blepharis grisea is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to low water conditions.
